paragraphs.text:
%md
## Building Model using Text Mining Capability in Oracle Machine Learning 
Oracle Machine Learning not only handles structured data, but also enables automatically building an model based on unstructured data like text. By leveraging Oracle Text functionality, useful features can be automatically extracted from the text column and then picked up to build the model automatically. 

In this notebook, we build an SVM model to predict customers most likely to be positive responders to an Affinity Card loyalty program. The data comes with a text column that contains user comments. With a few extra queries, the model automatically utilizes the text column in the dataset and build model on both structured and unstructured columns from the table. 


Copyright (c) 2020 Oracle Corporation                             
###### [The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0](https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/upl/)
---

msg.data:
Building Model using Text Mining Capability in Oracle Machine Learning

Oracle Machine Learning not only handles structured data, but also enables automatically building an model based on unstructured data like text. By leveraging Oracle Text functionality, useful features can be automatically extracted from the text column and then picked up to build the model automatically.

In this notebook, we build an SVM model to predict customers most likely to be positive responders to an Affinity Card loyalty program. The data comes with a text column that contains user comments. With a few extra queries, the model automatically utilizes the text column in the dataset and build model on both structured and unstructured columns from the table.

Copyright (c) 2020 Oracle Corporation

The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0

paragraphs.title: Import libraries and set display options
paragraphs.text:
%python

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import oml

pd.set_option('display.max_rows', 500)
pd.set_option('display.max_columns', 500)
pd.set_option('display.width', 1000)

paragraphs.title: Prepare data
paragraphs.text:
%python

CUSTOMERS = oml.sync( query = 'SELECT CUST_ID, COUNTRY_ID, CUST_GENDER,  2003-CUST_YEAR_OF_BIRTH AGE, CUST_MARITAL_STATUS, CUST_INCOME_LEVEL FROM sh.customers WHERE cust_id between 100001 and 104500')
SUPP_DEMO = oml.sync(query = '''SELECT CUST_ID,   EDUCATION, OCCUPATION, HOUSEHOLD_SIZE, YRS_RESIDENCE, AFFINITY_CARD,
 BULK_PACK_DISKETTES, FLAT_PANEL_MONITOR, HOME_THEATER_PACKAGE, BOOKKEEPING_APPLICATION, PRINTER_SUPPLIES, Y_BOX_GAMES,os_doc_set_kanji, comments FROM sh.supplementary_demographics''')
 
COUNTRIES = oml.sync(query = 'SELECT COUNTRY_NAME, COUNTRY_ID FROM SH.COUNTRIES')

paragraphs.title: Generate dataset by joining tables of customer details
paragraphs.text:
%python

MINING_DATA = CUSTOMERS.merge(SUPP_DEMO, how = "inner", on = 'CUST_ID',suffixes = ["",""])
MINING_DATA = MINING_DATA.merge(COUNTRIES, how = "inner", on = 'COUNTRY_ID', suffixes = ["", ""])
MINING_DATA = MINING_DATA[[ 'CUST_ID', 'CUST_GENDER', 'AGE', 'CUST_MARITAL_STATUS', 'COUNTRY_NAME', 'CUST_INCOME_LEVEL', 'EDUCATION', 'OCCUPATION', 'HOUSEHOLD_SIZE', 'YRS_RESIDENCE', 'AFFINITY_CARD', 'BULK_PACK_DISKETTES', 'FLAT_PANEL_MONITOR', 'HOME_THEATER_PACKAGE',
 'BOOKKEEPING_APPLICATION', 'PRINTER_SUPPLIES', 'Y_BOX_GAMES', 'OS_DOC_SET_KANJI', 'COMMENTS']]

paragraphs.title: Display a few rows of the dataset

msg.data:
CUST_ID	COMMENTS
103476	I am unhappy with the service at your store. Do not consider me a loyal customer just because I use your Affinity Card
102624	Could you send an Affinity Card to my mother in France?  Let me know and I'll send you here address.
103693	Thanks a lot for my new affinity card. I love the discounts and have since started shopping at your store for everything.
101639	The more times that I shop at your store, the more times I am impressed.  Don't change anything
102847	Affinity card makese sense only for bulk purchases. For all others, driving so far is not worth the discount. Either offer free shipping or build a store close by.

paragraphs.title: Filter out rows with no comments
paragraphs.text:
%python

MINING_TEXT = MINING_DATA[MINING_DATA['COMMENTS'].isnull() == False]
try:
    oml.drop(table = 'MINING_TEXT')
except:
    print("No such table")
MINING_TEXT.materialize(table = 'MINING_TEXT')
MINING_TEXT = oml.sync(table = 'MINING_TEXT')

paragraphs.title: Prepare the train and test datasets
paragraphs.text:
%python

dat = MINING_TEXT.split(ratio=(0.8, 0.2), seed = 6218945)
train_x = dat[0].drop('AFFINITY_CARD')
train_y = dat[0]['AFFINITY_CARD']
test_dat = dat[1]

paragraphs.title: Drop and create Oracle Text policy object
paragraphs.text:
%python

from oml import cursor
cur = cursor()
cur.execute("BEGIN  ctx_ddl.drop_policy('DM_SVM_POLICY'); EXCEPTION WHEN OTHERS THEN NULL; END;")
cur.execute("BEGIN ctx_ddl.create_policy('DM_SVM_POLICY'); END;")
cur.close()

paragraphs.title: Alternatively, drop and create Oracle Text policy in PL/SQL
Build the model combining structured data with unstructured text column

paragraphs.title: Display confusion matrix and ROC curve
paragraphs.text:
%python

def pred_plot(pred, target, name, settings):    
    import numpy as np
    import matplotlib
    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

    from sklearn.metrics import roc_curve
    from sklearn.metrics import roc_auc_score,auc

    pred_new = pred.concat({"PROBABILITY_OF_1":(pred["PREDICTION"]*
                            pred["PROBABILITY"]+
                            (-pred["PREDICTION"]+1)*
                            (-pred["PROBABILITY"]+1))})
    conf_matrix = pred_new.crosstab(target,'PREDICTION',pivot=True)
    
    # Statistics
    cf_local = conf_matrix.pull()
    TN = cf_local.iloc[0,1]
    TP = cf_local.iloc[1,2]
    FP = cf_local.iloc[0,2]
    FN = cf_local.iloc[1,1]
    TPR = TP/(TP+FN)
    FPR = FP/(FP+TN)
    TNR = TN/(TN+FP)
    FNR = FN/(FN+TP)
    Precision = TP/(TP+FP)
    Accuracy = (TP+TN)/(TP+TN+FP+FN)
    NPV = TN/(FN+TN)
    DetectionRate = TN/(FN+TN)
    BalancedAccuracy = (TPR+TNR)/2
    # Estimated AUC via Triangle (not very precise) could be
    # AUC = (1/2)*FPR*TPR + (1/2)*(1-FPR)*(1-TPR) + (1-FPR)*TPR
    
    # Compute real AUC using roc_curve by loading the
    # data locally
    pred_local = pred_new.pull().sample(frac = 0.1)
    fpr, tpr, _ = roc_curve(pred_local[[target]],pred_local[['PROBABILITY_OF_1']])
    AUC = auc(fpr, tpr)
    
    F1Score = 2*Precision*TPR/(Precision+TPR)
    MathewsCorrCoef = ((TP*TN)-(FP*FN))/((TP+FP)*(TP+FN)*(TN+FP)*(TN+FN))**0.5
    # Store all statistics to export
    statistics = {'Algorithm' : name,
                  'Algorithm_setting' : settings,
                  'TN' : TN,
                  'TP' : TP,
                  'FP' : FP,
                  'FN' : FN,
                  'TPR' : TPR,
                  'FPR' : FPR,
                  'TNR' : TNR,
                  'FNR' : FNR,
                  'Precision' : Precision,
                  'Accuracy' : Accuracy,
                  'NPV' : NPV,
                  'DetectionRate' : DetectionRate,
                  'BalancedAccuracy' : BalancedAccuracy,
                  'AUC' : AUC,
                  'F1Score' : F1Score,
                  'MathewsCorrCoef' : MathewsCorrCoef
                  }
    # Nice round stats for printing to screen
    TOTAL = TP+TN+FP+FN
    TN_P = (TN/TOTAL*100).round(2)
    FP_P = (FP/TOTAL*100).round(2)
    FN_P = (FN/TOTAL*100).round(2)
    TP_P = (TP/TOTAL*100).round(2)
    # Print the output nicely on Zeppelin native Table
    print("%table CONFUSION MATRIX\tPREDICTED 0\tPREDICTED 1\nACTUAL 0\t"+
          "True Negative: "+str(TN)+" ("+str(TN_P)+"%)\t"+
          "False Positive: "+str(FP)+" ("+str(FP_P)+"%)\nACTUAL 1\t"+
          "False Negative: "+str(FN)+" ("+str(FN_P)+"%)\t"+
          "True Positive: "+str(TP)+" ("+str(TP_P)+"%)\n"+
          "Accuracy: "+str((Accuracy*100).round(4))+"%"
          )
          
    TARGET = target
   # Multiple Charts for Evaluation
    fig, axes = plt.subplots(nrows=1, ncols=4,figsize=[20,5])
    ax1, ax2, ax3, ax4 = axes.flatten()
    fig.suptitle('Model Evaluation for '+str(name), size=16)

    # Statistics
    ax1.axis('off')
    

   # Function to return rounded numbers if the string is float, return
   # integers otherwise and return characters if not a number
    def round_if_float(content):
        try:
            val = float(content)
        except ValueError:
            return(content)
        else:
            if val.is_integer():
                return(int(content))
            else:
                return(round(float(content),4))

    for num, name in enumerate(statistics):
        ax1.text(0.01,  
                 (-num*0.06+0.94),
                 "{0}: {1}".format(name,round_if_float(statistics[name])),
                 ha='left', 
                 va='bottom', 
                 fontsize=12)
                 
    # Produce Lift Chart
    ax2.set_title('Lift Chart')
    data = pred_local.sort_values(by='PROBABILITY_OF_1', ascending=False)
    data['row_id'] = range(0,0+len(data))
    data['decile'] = ( data['row_id'] / (len(data)/10) ).astype(int)
    lift = data.groupby('decile')[TARGET].agg(['count','sum'])
    lift.columns = ['count', TARGET]
    lift['decile'] = range(1,11)

    data_ideal = pred_local.sort_values(by=TARGET, ascending=False)
    data_ideal['row_id'] = range(0,0+len(data))
    data_ideal['decile'] = ( data_ideal['row_id'] / (len(data_ideal)/10) ).astype(int)
    lift_ideal = data_ideal.groupby('decile')[TARGET].agg(['count','sum'])
    lift_ideal.columns = ['count', 'IDEAL']
    lift['IDEAL']=lift_ideal['IDEAL']

    ax2.bar(lift['decile'],lift['IDEAL']/lift['count'],color='darkorange', label='Ideal')
    ax2.bar(lift['decile'],lift[TARGET]/lift['count'],color='blue', alpha=0.6, label='Model')
    ax2.axhline((lift[TARGET]/lift['count']).mean(), color='grey', linestyle='--', label='Avg TARGET')
    ax2.set_ylim(0,1.15)
    ax2.set_xlabel('Decile', size=13)
    ax2.set_ylabel('Percent of Actual Targets', size=13)
    # Print labels.
    for dec in lift['decile']:
        ax2.text(dec, lift[lift.decile==dec][TARGET]/lift[lift.decile==dec]['count'] + 0.05,  
        ("%.0f" % int(round((lift[(lift.decile==dec)][TARGET]/lift[lift.decile==dec]['count'])*100,0)))+"%",
        ha='center', va='bottom')

    ax2.legend(loc="upper right")

   
    # Produce Gains Chart
    ax3.set_title('Distributions of Predictions')
    ax3.hist(pred_local[pred_local[TARGET]==1].PROBABILITY_OF_1, density=True, bins=25, alpha=.5, color='blue', label='1')
    ax3.hist(pred_local[pred_local[TARGET]==0].PROBABILITY_OF_1, density=True, bins=25, alpha=.5, color='darkorange', label='0')
    ax3.axvline(.5, color='grey', linestyle='--', label='Cutoff at 0.5')
    ax3.set_xlim([0,1])
    ax3.set_xlabel('Probability of 1', size=13)
    ax3.set_ylabel('Density', size=13)
    ax3.legend(loc="upper right")

    # ROC curve Chart
    ax4.set_title('ROC Curve')
    ax4.plot(fpr, tpr, color='blue', lw=2, label='ROC curve')

    ax4.plot([0, 1], [0, 1], lw=2, linestyle='--', color='grey', label='Random guess')

    ax4.annotate('AUC ='+str((AUC).round(4)), xy=(0.5, 0.4), xycoords='axes fraction', size=13)
    ax4.annotate('Precision ='+str((Precision).round(4)), xy=(0.45, 0.35), xycoords='axes fraction', size=13)
    ax4.annotate('Recall ='+str((TPR).round(4)), xy=(0.4, 0.3), xycoords='axes fraction', size=13)
    ax4.annotate('Accuracy ='+str((Accuracy).round(4)), xy=(0.35, 0.25), xycoords='axes fraction', size=13)
    ax4.annotate('F1 Score ='+str((F1Score).round(4)), xy=(0.3, 0.2), xycoords='axes fraction', size=13)
    ax4.set_xlim([-0.02, 1.02])
    ax4.set_ylim([0.0, 1.02])
    ax4.set_xlabel('False Positive Rate', size=13)
    ax4.set_ylabel('True Positive Rate', size=13)
    ax4.legend(loc="lower right")
pred_plot(pred[['AFFINITY_CARD','PREDICTION','PROBABILITY']], 'AFFINITY_CARD', 'SVM', settings = 'Text')
